item.title: Longtime CEO of Guinness Maker Diageo Dies at 63
item.description: Ivan Menezes is credited with growing the drinks company significantly since he became CEO in July 2013, with Diageo now selling around 200 brands in more than 180 markets.

item.title: Mercedes Teams Up With Green Steelmaker to Slash Emissions
item.description: In addition to securing supply for Mercedes’s European factories over the coming years, the companies have also agreed to explore potential steel production in North America.

item.title: Oil Drops For Second Day on Fresh Signs of Demand Weakness
item.description: Oil prices were lower for a second day with Chinese trade data showing a slump in exports and imports and as the EIA said U.S. demand will rise at a slower pace than expected this year.

item.title: Metals Mixed Despite Bright Spots in China Data
item.description: Base metals prices were mixed, while gold dropped, as demand concerns and macro headwinds continued to weigh, with a strong dollar impacting investor appetite and despite bright spots in data coming from China, ANZ said.

item.title: Dollar Edges Up; Traders Stay Wary of Selling Before Next Week's US CPI Data
item.description: The dollar edged higher as traders are wary of selling the currency before Tuesday’s U.S. inflation data and despite growing speculation the Fed could pause raising rates next week, ING said.

item.title: Inditex Earnings Rise, Sees Steady Growth
item.description: Inditex reported first-quarter underlying earnings of €2.2 billion, and said it expected a stable gross margin for 2023, plus or minus 50 basis points.

item.title: Brazil Is Key to Slowing Global Warming. But Its Carbon Market Has Struggled.
item.description: A new attempt to create a regulated cap-and-trade system that is seen as key for corporate competitiveness and economic resilience faces political headwinds.

item.title: Irish Bonds Seen as Relative Underperformers Ahead of Auction
item.description: Irish government bonds have underperformed versus peers over the past few days, pushing Irish-French yield spreads, especially in 5-10-years sectors, close to the upper end of their past six months’ ranges, J.P.Morgan said.

item.title: German Industrial Production Lags Estimates
item.description: German industrial output rose 0.3% in April on month, ticking up less than expected, as car manufacturing dipped, adding to concerns about the country’s key manufacturing base.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.8%, Dragged by Chip-Related Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower as profit-taking weighed on chip-related stocks and other electronics makers following their recent ascent.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank of Australia Restricts Staff From Using ChatGPT
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Australia’s largest lender, Commonwealth Bank of Australia, has restricted its employees from using popular artificial-intelligence chatbot ChatGPT, instead setting up and operating its own in-house system.

item.title: Who Is Brian Armstrong? Coinbase CEO Is Taking On the SEC
item.description: The biggest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange’s long-running clash with regulators is coming to a head.

item.title: Treasury's $1 Trillion Debt Deluge Threatens Market Calm
item.description: The U.S. government could face borrowing at rates near 6%, up from 0.1% less than two years ago.

item.title: Sequoia Capital, one of the most powerful names in technology investing, said it would separate its China and U.S. businesses.
item.description: Sequoia Capital, one of the most powerful names in technology investing, said it would separate its China and U.S. businesses.

item.title: Some of CNN's highest-profile hosts are expressing concerns to management about Licht's ability to keep leading the network, people close to the situation said.
item.description: Some of CNN’s highest-profile hosts are expressing concerns to management about Licht’s ability to keep leading the network, people close to the situation said.

item.title: Arrests along the southern border have dropped by about 70% after the expiration of Title 42 and the implementation of a new set of rules for asylum seekers, the Biden administration said.
item.description: Arrests along the southern border have dropped by about 70% after the expiration of Title 42 and the implementation of a new set of rules for asylum seekers, the Biden administration said.

item.title: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq edged up 0.2% and 0.4%, respectively, to clinch closing highs for the year, while the Dow ticked up 0.03%.
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq edged up 0.2% and 0.4%, respectively, to clinch closing highs for the year, while the Dow ticked up 0.03%.

item.title: Boeing said that it would delay deliveries of its 787 Dreamliners in the coming weeks after discovering a new defect.
item.description: Boeing said that it would delay deliveries of its 787 Dreamliners in the coming weeks after discovering a new defect.

item.title: A New York-based federal appeals court considered a closely watched case over transgender girls' participation in female competition categories for school sports.
item.description: A New York-based federal appeals court considered a closely watched case over transgender girls’ participation in female competition categories for school sports.

item.title: The World Bank sees better global economic growth in 2023 than it previously estimated, but still expects slowing growth in the second half of the year.
item.description: The World Bank sees better global economic growth in 2023 than it previously estimated, but still expects slowing growth in the second half of the year.
